title: TMC Election Results 2017 LIVE
text:
Shiv Sena leading in 20 seats of Thane. Sumit Bhoir, son of Shiv Sena MLA Subhash Bhoir loses. Load More 
Thane, Feb 23: Voting for Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) along with 9 other Municipal Corporations ended on February 21. The results of all the 10 municipal corporations will be declared today. Thane witnessed a total voter turnout of 58.11 percent compared to 53.25 percent voter turnout in 2012 elections. The live updates on Thane Municipal Corporation will be updated here. It is expected that the counting of votes in Thane will begin at 10 AM. The major key parties contesting in Thane Municipal Corporation includes Shiv Sena , Bharatiya Janata Party , Nationalist Congress Party , Congress , Maharashtra Navnirman Sena and All India Majlis-e-Ittehad-ul Muslimeen. 
In the 2017 elections, voters in Ghodbunder, Kalwa, Wagle Estate, Kausa, Rabodi and other localities voted in large numbers which were one of the prime reasons of high voting in the elections. Kausa was at the centre of attraction in the city as more than ten per cent of the corporators are elected from Kausa. 
Considered to be the traditional seat of Shiv Sena, Shiv Sena MLA and PWD Minister of state Eknath Shinde did massive campaigning for his party in Thane. Apart from Eknath Shinde, Rajan Vichare, Pratap Sarnaik, Ravindra Fatak and mayor Sanjay More also campaigned massively for Shiv Sena in the city. 
In the 2012 elections, Shiv Sena formed its government in the city. In 2012 elections, Sena won 54 seats out of 130 seats. NCP remained on the second spot winning 34 seats followed by Congress which was able in gaining 18 seats. BJP and MNS won 7 seats each and BSP won 2 seats in the elections. Parties
